content.title: GSV Ablation Techniques Compared
content.definition: A comparative analysis of endovenous ablation modalities for great saphenous vein incompetence including thermal, chemical, and mechanical methods.

concepts.definition: Thermal ablation using radiofrequency energy to heat and occlude the vein.

clinical_features.mechanism: Resistive heating of vein wall to 120°C
Laser energy absorbed by blood/water/vein wall
clinical_features.disadvantages: More post-procedure pain with older wavelengths

clinical_features.mechanism: Polymer adhesive physically occludes vein lumen
clinical_features.advantages: No tumescent, no thermal injury risk, minimal post-procedure pain
clinical_features.disadvantages: Phlebitis in 10-15%, foreign body remains, cost
Slightly lower occlusion rates, technique dependent

clinical_features.current_preference: Thermal ablation (RFA/EVLA) remains first-line in most centers
